prompt: Visualizing the optimistic $\bar{\mu} = \bar{\theta}_0$. $\mu^*$ represents the true $\theta_0^*$. Suppose A and B have different estimates of $\theta_0$, where $\mu^*$ lines between $[\hat{\mu}, \bar{\mu}]$ with probability $1 - \delta$. The orange lines for $[\hat{\mu}_A', \bar{\mu}_A']$ and $[\hat{\mu}_B', \bar{\mu}_B']$ denote the worst case scenario for $\Delta_{\mu} = \bar{\mu}_B' - \hat{\mu}_A'$ due to misspecification.
